intro: Rhinanthus × gardineri, commonly known as the hybrid common tickseed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. This plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. Its flowers are yellow and occur in clusters, and it produces small, dry fruits called capsules. Rhinanthus × gardineri is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
